title: Fan, ca. 1760
medium: Medium: skin painted in gouache (mount), carved, gilded and painted (sticks)
description: Obverse mount shows a King returning from war being greeted by a group of women dancing and playing musical instruments. Trophies of musical instruments to the right and left. On the reverse, two women in a landscape setting. Sticks are carved in an openwork design (à jour), gilded and painted. At center are two couples: the men are standing, the women are seated. Red jewels set in each end of the pin.

tombstone.epitaph:
Fan, ca. 1760.
ca. 1760. Medium: skin painted in gouache (mount), carved, gilded and painted (sticks). Bequest of Sarah Cooper Hewitt. 1931-6-111.
